title: Upvote If You Want A Support Champion Next
body:
The last real support we got was Tahm Kench and since then we've gotten 2 junglers, 3 top laners (including camille), 2 mid mages, and a god tier adc, Riot wants to popularize the support role and even as a support main it's getting boring playing the same champions and it's making me lean more towards the mid lane and i'm sure others feel the same way

I just wish we got something to make people want to play support, or at the very least give us support mains a reason to stick around

Yea need a lot more high skillcap supports. Tired of only seeing {{champion:40}} {{champion:267}} that fit that.
Add soraka and sona to that list

Soraka has a point and click heal and some wide cc...It's not that hard to mess up assassins, especially since they have longer burst windows. Sona has only 1 skillshot and it's a wide almost instant ulti. Those are some of the easiest supports, since they aren't at all mechanically challenging.

That is not what makes Sona difficult.

 You are right, mechanically she is among the easiest supports since her only skillshot is crescendo (which gets harder to hit as your opponents being to anticipate it in higher ranks of play). In exchange? She is arguably the least forgiving support. Sona has just about nothing to get caught out of a bad situation between little mobility, no hard CC til 6, and being the squishiest support. If she gets caught in a gank, she is dead if she doesn't have flash unless you misplay hard. Other supports like Thresh, Janna, and Nami have a lot more options if they get caught on the wrong foot. Additionally, Sona is one of the harder supports to position with. To be a threat, you need to be inside that Q range constantly and you need to go up front if you want to land a good crescendo without flash. Plus, she benefits her teammates (even the front line) by standing near them... moreso than most other supports. She can't stand 20 ft away from the fight like Janna, Soraka or Nami ot be effective. Yet she doesn't have the CC or resilience to front line like Alistar or Leona.

And it seems to me that it is very difficult to manage her mana.  I have never played her myself but it is so easy to counter her being a Taric main myself.  I just sit back and wait for her to run out of mana and then all in for a win every single time.

Ehh, it seems that way but it's not really that bad.

The reason you'll see her OOM a lot of time is simply because she can afford to be so. Unlike champions like Nami who need their full kit to function, Sona only needs her Q and W in lane. Hence why you'll often see her OOM early game : she can afford to. Keeping enough mana for a clutch W is all she really cares about. And unlike Lulu, who can potentially use all 3 of her spells only to poke, Sona really only has Q to cast.

Late-game she starts using her whole kit and then you really feel that mana problem, but at that point you have the option to itemize for it, so it's less of a Sona issue and more of a player one.

There's nothing left to learn other than auto for your passive, i fail to see how skill capping her is hard, i myself have done it, and if you're referring to what i said about soraka that was a typo :p

Maining Sona at a Bronze level and maining Sona at a Diamond or higher level are two completely different things. Her skill floor is really, really low (you can spam all your abilities and have a pretty decent impact on fights), but her skill ceiling is pretty high once you master positioning, timing and choosing your power chords correctly, etc.

Not to mention her ult is one of the highest impact ults out of any support, being really difficult to land on multiple people if your opponents know what they're doing. She may be an easy support to pick up and play, but that doesn't mean she's an easy support to master.

^ This. Nice job writing this!

Do people not realize that the different power chords have nice big differences worth preparing your spells for? They're too good to simply go without mentioning them! Skill cap goes beyond her mechanics and towards positioning and saving abilities for the right time!

Thanks! I've been a Sona main for a pretty decent amount of time now, and while I don't play against high mmr players very often, it's kinda sad to see people say she has a low skill ceiling.

I'm usually lazy and just spam the Q power chord (especially since I build balls-to-the-wall AP pretty often), but I've been trying to get better at actually using them properly. The E chord is sooo good for securing kills on slippery champions or locking them down ever harder.
